text: Sprague is an unincorporated community in Bates County, in the U.S. state of Missouri. ==History== A post office called Sprague was established in 1880, and remained in operation until 1926. Some say the community was named after Charles Sprague, a local storekeeper, while others believe the name honors H. C. Sprague, a railroad official. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Bates County, Missouri Category:Unincorporated communities in Missouri
title: Sprague, Missouri
